results.title: Cutout animation
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Eric Halliday and Davis Johnson
results.brief_description: A very good hands-on type film which will show students a way of getting into animation by some means other than drawing. A similar type of animation as seen in the opening credits of the Monty Python Show is shown.

results.title: Cut your home heating costs
results.creator_credit: Rodale Press, Auska Videobooks, Jeff Cox, John Hoskyns-Abrahall, Dave Herman and Barbara Anson
results.brief_description: A two part program that looks at ways to cut your home heating costs. Pt 1. How to keep the heat in your house: Looks at where the most common energy leaks around the home are and how to halt heat loss with weather stripping, caulk, insulation, and window coverings. Pt 2. Wood heat: Examines how to start heating the home with wood. How to evaluate your home’s wood heating capacity, how to select the best stove, how to get more from your fireplace and how to maintain your stove safely are all examined. NB - forms for calculating energy use, mentioned in this video are not available in Australia.

results.title: Cut or mix
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Television Overseas and Gordon Severn
results.brief_description: Shows situations in television production in which the choice between a cut and a mix has to be made and gives some guidelines to assist the director in making the correct decision. In many cases the exact timing of a cut can be important, and examples are shown and explained in detail, showing cutting on action and on change of ideas. Intended for trainee television producers.

results.title: Customer service
results.brief_description: The aim of this manual is to present knowledge and techniques required to develop and maintain on-going service to customers and to convert complaints into appointments to further strengthen customer ties. A video which complements this manual may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Custody
results.creator_credit: Tristram Miall, Film Australia and Ian Munro
results.brief_description: Custody follows an estranged couple, Christine and Andrew Byrne, down the twisting and highly emotional path that eventually leads to a fully contested case in the Family Court. Along the way it shows the points of view of both parents, and the somewhat different view taken by the lawyers and the Court Counsellors who become involved. Above all, it dramatically shows what it is like to go through the Family Court. The members of the Byrne family are actors. The legal aid representative, the solicitors, the barristers and members of the judiciary all play themselves.

results.title: Custodians of the bush
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Under southern skies”.
Sue Henckel travels to far north Queensland to meet Thancoupie, an Aboriginal healer, who explains the ancient tradition of holistic medicine that nurtures, heals and protects. Thancoupie provides an education on the qualities and properties of Australian native flora, showing that it is the hunter gatherers who have provided the rich source of essential substances used in modern medicines.

results.title: Custard the Dragon
results.brief_description: Everyone, including Belinda, thinks Custard the Dragon is a complete coward until a nasty pirate comes to steal their Xmas presents and Custard deals with him in his own special way.
